instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, have green charging light
threads.message: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on,no signs of water damge,  have a green charging light, ppbus g3h is 12.51v , missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>, at <TRANSISTOR>Q7910</TRANSISTOR> i get 3.3v on pin 4 and 3.1v at pin 3 yet nothing going to pins 1,2,5,6 , there is no short on any of the pins of <TRANSISTOR>Q7910</TRANSISTOR>, i have tried jumping from pin 4 to pins 1,2,5,6 and it will stay at 3.3v but still wont turn on (also have changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7910</TRANSISTOR>) am i looking in the wrong place ???

threads.title: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, have green charging light
threads.message:
Do you get correct voltage at L7770?

Check ressitance to ground at L6995, on 200k scale.

Also check MCP's RTC signals and oscillation at Y2810.

threads.title: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, have green charging light
threads.message: Hi voltage at l7770 is 1.05v, dont have 200k scale on meter but in diode mode it reads 0.323 which is the same as a working board

threads.title: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, have green charging light
threads.message:
I never saw multimeter w/o 200k scale.
You probably have auto-range one and should check on ohm scale then.
Even that should have range select option.
Diode mode is not sufficient, you should get more than 30k there...

What about the other signals?

threads.title: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, have green charging light
threads.message: yes meter is autorange i get 0.646 kohms , range only has Ohms ,Kohms and Mohms, what do you mean by MCP's ?

threads.title: Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on, have green charging light
threads.message:
That value points to a bad MCP79.
The other signals required I supposed to be bad too...
